title: Is Maurice Salib the most hated Love Island contestant ever?
text:
Love Island Australia viewers took to Twitter on Monday night to unleash on Maurice Salib.

Fans branded the 27-year-old 'narcissistic' and a 'player', after he claimed to have not been in a serious relationship prior to going on the show.

Earlier on in the episode, an article of his 'ex-girlfriend' Christie Swadling claiming he dumped her just two weeks prior to entering the villa, circulated through the group.

Scroll down for video

Is Maurice Salib (pictured) the most hated Love Island contestant ever? Viewers took to Twitter on Monday, insisting that Cynthia Taylu made a mistake by choosing him over Sam Withers

One viewer got creative, drafting a poll asking other Twitter users: 'Which word most describes Maurice? Narcissistic, shallow, self-obsessed, slimy.'

Others said Cynthia Taylu made a 'regrettable decision' by choosing to keep Maurice safe in the competition by coupling up with her, and sending Sam Withers home.

'How can Cynthia still decide to couple up with Maurice even after the news they got? He's truly fake and needs to go,' one wrote.

Vocal: Fans branded the 27-year-old 'narcissistic' and a 'player', after he claimed to have not been in a serious relationship prior to going on the show

Another added: 'Maurice continues to think he's smarter than everybody because he's able to fool people like Cynthia. Such a regrettable decision.'

Suggesting the media manager is a 'player', one viewer shared online: 'Maurice will dump Cynthia the second an alternative walks through the gate. Bad decision babe.'

A similar Tweet also read: 'Is my dear Cynthia colour blind? She's got to be. How can she not see all these red flags Maurice is wearing?'

One Tweet read: 'Is my dear Cynthia colour blind? She's got to be. How can she not see all these red flags Maurice is wearing?'

Drama: On Monday night, Cynthia (centre), 23, discovered an article where Maurice's 'ex-girlfriend' Christie Swadling claimed he dumped her two weeks before going on the show

On Monday night, Cynthia discovered an article where Maurice's 'ex-girlfriend' Christie Swadling claimed he dumped her two weeks before going on the show.

Asked by Cynthia, 23, as to when his last relationship was, Maurice responded: 'My last relationship was like a year ago.'

An unfazed Maurice picked up the article published in the 'Love Island Times', laughed at the claims and said 'this is dumb'.

Downplaying the romance: Asked by Cynthia as to when his last relationship was, Maurice responded: 'My last relationship was like a year ago,' adding that it was never anything serious

Case of the ex: Christie (pictured) has insisted on numerous occasions to have been in a committed relationship with Maurice for several months

The business owner insisted to Cynthia and the rest of the group that his former romance prior to entering the villa, was never anything serious.

'It was never really 'official official', no,' he said. 'We were just seeing each other, yeah.'

'Never boyfriend and girlfriend,' Maurice added. 'We were seeing each other, but it was never serious.'

Christie unleashed on Instagram Stories on Monday night, stating that Maurice has 'no legs' to stand on as she documents her entire life online as an influencer.
description: Love Island Australia viewers unleashed on Twitter on Monday night, after Maurice Salib, 27, claimed to have not been in a serious relationship prior to going on the show.
authors: Kristy Johnson For Daily Mail Australia
